title: TOI
content:
Israel’s hostage deal with Hamas has reached a grim conclusion. All 20 living hostages have been released, but IDF confirms no one else is alive in Hamas captivity. Among the missing is Bipin Joshi from Nepal, who became a symbol of courage when he deflected a grenade during the October 7 attack. His family has not given up hope. As Israel releases thousands of Palestinian prisoners in exchange, the fate of Bipin and other unaccounted hostages remains shrouded in uncertainty. Israel’s hostage deal with Hamas has reached a grim conclusion. All 20 living hostages have been released, but IDF confirms no one else is alive in Hamas captivity. Among the missing is Bipin Joshi from Nepal, who became a symbol of courage when he deflected a grenade during the October 7 attack. His family has not given up hope. As Israel releases thousands of Palestinian prisoners in exchange, the fate of Bipin and other unaccounted hostages remains shrouded in uncertainty.

Hamas is preparing to release 48 Israeli hostages ahead of the Monday deadline under the first phase of the Gaza ceasefire deal. The group has relocated the hostages to several locations and will meet Red Cross officials tonight to finalize release logistics. However, the exchange faces uncertainty as Hamas demands the release of seven high-profile Palestinian prisoners, including Marwan Barghouti and Ahmad Saadat. Israel has so far refused, though Hamas is offering an earlier release in return. Talks are ongoing to resolve the timing, prisoner list, and return of bodies as part of the ceasefire implementation.
